question_text: Which of the following are key differences between Wi-Fi analyzers and spectrum analyzers? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: Spectrum analyzers can detect non-Wi-Fi signals
Wi-Fi analyzers provide SSID and channel details
Wi-Fi analyzers require physical access to the router
Spectrum analyzers show raw RF signal strength across frequencies
correct_answer: Spectrum analyzers can detect non-Wi-Fi signals
Wi-Fi analyzers provide SSID and channel details
Spectrum analyzers show raw RF signal strength across frequencies
explanation: Wi-Fi analyzers interpret 802.11 traffic and show logical Wi-Fi details like SSIDs and channels. Spectrum analyzers visualize all RF signals, not just Wi-Fi, without needing logical protocol interpretation.
